text: Core pseudoknots consist of a root stem and a linkage stem that often forms at the 39 end of the structure (the ''leading edge'' in Fig. 4a ). In its most basic form, it is also referred to as a H-type PK or an ABAB PK [29, 30] . However, the core PK can be embellished with complex motifs of RNA structure to any extent required as long as these structures are thermodynamically stable (Text S2).
